channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Scott Morrison aims for full reopening of Australian economy by July, global COVID-19 cases surpass 3.9 million as Australian death toll stands at 97

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: Parcel deliveries of trackies, hoodies and PJs are off the charts as we communally crave comfort.
item.title: We are all individuals – except for our iso buying habits

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: Baby love galore, but beloved family catch-ups are out for new mothers on isolation Mother's Day.
item.title: No cuddles from grandparents on a 'once-in-a-century' Mother's Day

item.description: Little Richard, the self-proclaimed "architect of rock 'n' roll" who built his groundbreaking sound with a boiling blend of boogie-woogie, rhythm and blues and gospel, died on Saturday at the age of 87, Rolling Stone magazine reported.
item.title: Rock legend Little Richard dead at age 87

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: As the Melbourne abattoir COVID-19 cluster continues to spread, authorities are examining an animal welfare complaint amid general concern over work practices at abattoirs.
item.title: Cedar Meats outbreak reaches 75 as authorities investigate animal cruelty

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Some argue we shouldn’t need a date on the calendar to remind us to honour our mothers – and they are right – but if there was ever a year when mothers needed a collective morale boost, it’s this one.
item.title: Mother's Day returns to its humble origins

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 10, 2020

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Coronavirus 5G conspiracy theories on social media haven't been able to hurt demand for the high-speed technology, says Nokia's Australian boss Anna Wills.
item.title: Nokia accelerates 5G rollout as users ignore COVID-19 conspiracy talk

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: The arts precinct is in administration but philanthropists are offering stop-gap funds while artists call for a government lifeline.
item.title: Financial and artistic support pours in for Carriageworks

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Adaptability is the name of the game when streets, beaches, parks and restaurants are empty and critical areas are no-go zones.
item.title: From COVID-19 testing clinics to funeral homes: behind the lenses of the Herald's photographers

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: Premier Gladys Berejiklian has announced cafes and restaurants, playgrounds and outdoor pools have made the cut for early reopening.
item.title: NSW to ease lockdown restrictions from Friday

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: With no other live sport on show, Randwick and Flemington are being beamed into lounges across the nation as horse racing recaptures a bygone era.
item.title: How the sport of kings (and the Queen) defied the COVID lockdown

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: After almost two years as Archbishop of Melbourne Peter Comensoli remains an elusive figure to many Catholics, and a study in contrasts to the wider public.
item.title: 'I'm not a used car salesman': Can the archbishop chart a new course?

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: Life in lockdown has been a mixed blessing for families, causing stress and anxiety but also creating opportunities for family togetherness and bonding.
item.title: Families in lockdown, some struggle while others thrive

item.dc:creator: Danny Weidler
item.description: Thurston, one of the the NRL's greatest Indigenous players, also has strong opinions on where the Souths star is in life as well as his career.
item.title: Mitchell should turn to Goodes for help, says Thurston

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Whistleblowers are discussing the prospect of taking industrial action, which would be a huge blow to hopes of restarting the season at the end of the month.
item.title: 'Outrageous': One-referee plan for NRL sparks strike threat

item.description: Amid the pandemic pandemonium continues, Mother's Day is an opportunity to think about how we can rebuild the world for the next generation.
item.title: Hope springs maternal, the Mother's Day wish list

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: The controversial scheme set up by George Pell to compensate victims of clergy abuse is set to be scrapped as Australia’s bishop’s develop new national protocols for survivors.
item.title: New church abuse protocols to replace controversial compo scheme

item.dc:creator: Letitia Rowlands
item.description: Life in isolation for Prime Minister Scott Morrison's wife Jenny has been "challenging" but she says at least one good thing came out of it.
item.title: Isolated life at The Lodge brings the Morrisons closer

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: As thousands of NSW students prepare to return to classrooms this week, many parents are opting to drive their children to school and avoid public transport.
item.title: Anxious parents and students face school commute amid lockdown

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Department of Education Secretary Mark Scott said it would be a while before regular calendar events such as assemblies, excursions and school sport resumed.
item.title: Teachers to adapt lessons to focus on most important aspects

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Australia will suffer a population slowdown as the coronavirus crisis discourages women from having children, leading to a slump in the birth rate that will drag down the economy.
item.title: Baby-bump slump pokes hole in Treasury forecasts

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Liberal senators and MPs have raised concerns restrictions in Victoria will not be lifted quickly enough by Premier Daniel Andrews after Prime Minister Scott Morrison laid out a plan to open up businesses as the spread of coronavirus eases in major cities.
item.title: 'Only ones who can’t celebrate Mother’s Day': Liberal MPs and senators critical of Victoria lockdown

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: The number of fines or charges issued under the public health order fell to an average of five a day last week.
item.title: Police ease up on COVID-19 fines as pandemic progresses

item.dc:creator: Zach Hope
item.description: While you won’t know their names, the expressive faces of sign language interpreters have become as ubiquitous as the nation’s leaders.
item.title: 'But seriously, I'm really nervous': the everywhere faces of Auslan interpreters and their vital work

item.dc:creator: Lucy Manly
item.description: A first-class trip to Mykonos or the pristine waters of the French Riviera are but a distant memory for the eastern suburbs style-set.
item.title: Sydneysiders park Euro plans for a vacation close to home

item.dc:creator: Julia Naughton
item.description: Gathering with loved ones may feel like an impossible luxury, but families are still finding ways to celebrate the women in their lives this Mother's Day.
item.title: Sourdough crumpets and a surf: Mother's Day in lockdown

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: The introduction of the HPV vaccine in 2007 is likely to have prevented 2000 Australian babies being born premature over eight years.
item.title: HPV vaccine linked to decline in premature births

item.dc:creator: Zach Hope
item.description: Mother's Day in the coronavirus age needn't be missing its key ingredients - flowers, sweets, and love.
item.title: A socially distant Mother's Day, but still with key ingredients

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: Eden-Monaro was looking gloomy for Labor until the Deputy Premier dropped in, then dropped out, then dropped a few bombs.
item.title: Roll out the Barilaro, oh what a barrel of funsters

item.dc:creator: Lucy Manly
item.description: The craze has gone from the gym to the (home) office.
item.title: Activewear is the new normal for work

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: The careers, studies, travel plans and social lives of young people in Sydney have been dramatically affected by COVID-19.
item.title: 'My entire life is different': How COVID-19 upended the lives of young people

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Similar mines – including two of its own – actually cause 30 times more emissions.
item.title: 'We stuffed up': Coal miner admits to submitting wrong emissions data

item.dc:creator: Michael Idato
item.description: Like many people separated from their loved ones, the actress will not spend this Mother's Day with her mum, Janelle.
item.title: Tea with mum: Nicole Kidman's Mother's Day wish

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: The Brisbane band's members are turning isolation to their advantage, finishing a new single in tribute to their mum while in lockdown.
item.title: Sheppard pen Mother's Day anthem from isolation

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: 24 hour bookshops and chemists and after-hours bars and galleries in office foyers are part of an ambitious plan to revive Sydney’s night time economy.
item.title: 'Make Parramatta, Chatswood and Hornsby late night destinations'

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: Sydney's 'undiscovered jewel' has seen people return to the historic site during the coronavirus crisis.
item.title: Government urged to act on Callan Park revamp plan

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: A decline in schooling quality caused by coronavirus-related disruptions will cost Australia the equivalent of $6 billion a quarter in foregone knowledge and skills.
item.title: Wellbeing hit: modelling reveals huge cost of school closures

item.dc:creator: Lyndon Terracini
item.description: Opera Australia's artistic director writes that many young artists will need to forget their dream and retrain, but he argues tax breaks could help revive the youthful adventure of the nation's cultural life.
item.title: As young artists watch their dreams vanish, our cultural democracy is in peril

item.description: Now is the perfect time to catch up on the best books, films, television shows, music and podcasts you might have missed.
item.title: Top five: best podcasts by women for women

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: This strange new era of constant video calls has thrown the humble bookshelf into primetime prominence.
item.title: What's on the shelf? Our home libraries are having a moment in the spotlight

item.dc:creator: Andrew Hornery
item.description: Erin Molan suspected those cloying saccharine "we're all in this together" TV promos might backfire - but she says she can laugh at herself too.
item.title: No, we're not all in this together

item.dc:creator: Nigel Gladstone
item.description: Sydney-based short term rental accommodation businesses are struggling, with one collapsing while holding up to 60 tenancies.
item.title: 'It's a train wreck': Coronavirus brings Airbnb property investors undone

item.dc:creator: Melissa Singer
item.description: In honour of what would have been Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia's 25th anniversary, the creative minds behind five unforgettable shows took us behind the scenes.
item.title: Rats, rain and romance: backstage at fashion week's most iconic shows

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: The pandemic poses a unique challenge for Australians with OCD. About two months into the crisis in Australia, Lucie Alexandra says her hands look like she’s been “down in the mines for 15 years”.
item.title: For weeks, Lucie hid her hands from her partner. Then he saw the blood

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: The Australian operator of a cruise ship that set sail for Antarctica in the same week the deadly coronavirus was declared a pandemic is facing a major class action after 128 passengers and crew onboard the ill-fated Greg Mortimer became infected
item.title: 'They played Russian roulette with our lives': Cruise ship passengers to sue

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: Intensive care doctors say easing our COVID lockdown won't put the health system at risk.
item.title: ICU doctors say risk of hospitals being overrun has passed

item.dc:creator: Julie Szego
item.description: We are shell-shocked, vulnerable, and fearful: for our jobs, our health, our families. People are crying out for leaders to protect and provide for them. To mother them.
item.title: Mother's Day in the time of COVID-19
